original: hr'a di nam ni rdo rje glog / aa tharba ni srid bsrung dang // bram ze'i bye brag dag la'o //
analyzed: hr'a di nam ni rdo rje glog / aa tharba ni srid bsrung dang // bram ze'i bye brag dag la'o //
translated: Atharva is for the protection of existence and for the different brahmins.

original: aadhishtha na mthu dang grong //
analyzed: aadhishtha na mthu dang grong //
translated: Adhisthana is power and village.

original: lhag par gnas dang 'khor lo la //
analyzed: lhag par gnas dang 'khor lo la //
translated: Adhivasa is for the special abodes and for the wheel.

original: aa nu tsa na dul ba dang // 'grogs dang rig byed mkhas pa dang // rtse mo gug dang pho nyid la'ang //
analyzed: aa nu tsa na dul ba dang // 'grogs dang rig byed mkhas pa dang // rtse mo gug dang pho nyid la'ang //
translated: Anucana is for the tamed, for companionship, for skill in the Vedas, for the curved peak, and also for the messenger.

original: aa n'a sa nam bstan pa dang // gos gshar ba dang nye ba'i stan //
analyzed: aa n'a sa nam bstan pa dang // gos gshar ba dang nye ba'i stan //
translated: Anasana is for the teaching, for washing clothes, and for a nearby seat.

original: aa b'a tsi nam go zlog dang // lho dang phyogs ngos skye nges la //
analyzed: aa b'a tsi nam go zlog dang // lho dang phyogs ngos skye nges la //
translated: Avacanam is for the Purva-Shaila and for the Dakshina-Shaila, for those born in the directions.

original: aa bhi dze na rigs su grags //
analyzed: aa bhi dze na rigs su grags //
translated: Abhijna is known as the clan.

original: kyi rgyal mtshan dag la'o //
analyzed: kyi rgyal mtshan dag la'o //
translated: Abhijna is for the kings of the Khasa.

original: aa bhi panna mngon par sgrub //
analyzed: aa bhi panna mngon par sgrub //
translated: Abhipanna is for the accomplishment.

original: mngon par sod dang zos dang rgud //
analyzed: mngon par sod dang zos dang rgud //
translated: Abhimana is for the manifest, for the eaten, and for the decline.

original: lto dang rang gis byas pa la //
analyzed: lto dang rang gis byas pa la //
translated: Udara is for the belly and for what is done by oneself.

original: aa bhi m'a na skyes bu'i snyems //
analyzed: aa bhi m'a na skyes bu'i snyems //
translated: Abhimana is for the pride of a person.

original: shes dang / pra na ya dang 'tshe //
analyzed: shes dang / pra na ya dang 'tshe //
translated: Pramana is for knowledge, for the weapon, and for the weapon.

original: 'gro byed nyi ma nyi ma'i zas //
analyzed: 'gro byed nyi ma nyi ma'i zas //
translated: Gamanam is for the sun and for the food of the sun.

original: pha mes rnams kyi lha la'o //
analyzed: pha mes rnams kyi lha la'o //
translated: Pitri-deva is for the gods of the ancestors.

original: aa ba d'a ni /
analyzed: aa ba d'a ni /
translated: Avadana is for the Avadana.

original: las de dag / de lta bu byung rtogs brjod dum //
analyzed: las de dag / de lta bu byung rtogs brjod dum //
translated: These are the verbal roots for the past tense.

original: lus dbugs dang ni kun sbyor dang // kun nas sbyor ba mngon par brjod //
analyzed: lus dbugs dang ni kun sbyor dang // kun nas sbyor ba mngon par brjod //
translated: Kāya is body, prāṇa is breath, saṃyoga is union, and saṃyojana is fetter.

original: a'a ka la ni som nyi dang // yongs su bgrang dang rnam par 'ching //
analyzed: a'a ka la ni som nyi dang // yongs su bgrang dang rnam par 'ching //
translated: Āka is doubt, saṃkhyā is enumeration, and saṃbandha is bondage.

original: a'atstsha da nam kha chod dang // gos dang / sgrib par byed pa la //
analyzed: a'atstsha da nam kha chod dang // gos dang / sgrib par byed pa la //
translated: Ācchatā is a covering, and vastrā is a cloth.

original: a'a ta nam ni so sor gnas //🔽rgyug par byed dang bgrod par 'dod //
analyzed: a'a ta nam ni so sor gnas // rgyug par byed dang bgrod par 'dod //

original: a'atma yo ni rnam spro byed //
analyzed: a'atma yo ni rnam spro byed //
translated: Dhāvatā is running, and gamanīya is desirous of going.🔽Ātma is expansion.

original: yid las byung ba mngon par brjod //🔽a'a ba sha nam /
analyzed: yid las byung ba mngon par brjod // a'a ba sha nam /
translated: Manas is mental.🔽Āvasatha is a workshop.

original: bzo khang dang // 'byung po'i gnas dang rab 'jug pa //
analyzed: bzo khang dang // 'byung po'i gnas dang rab 'jug pa //

original: a'a yo dha no 'khrug dang gsod //
analyzed: a'a yo dha no 'khrug dang gsod //
translated: Āyodhana is fighting, and vadha is killing.

original: 'thab par byed pa la 'dod do //
analyzed: 'thab par byed pa la 'dod do //
translated: Yuddha is fighting.

original: a'a ra dha nam mchod pa dang / mtshed dang 'thab pa dag la yang //
analyzed: a'a ra dha nam mchod pa dang / mtshed dang 'thab pa dag la yang //
translated: Āradhana is worship, and āli is a canal.

original: aa skanda ni mi mngon dang / kun nas skems dang sgra la'o //🔽autpa ta nam kun nas skyes //
analyzed: aa skanda ni mi mngon dang / kun nas skems dang sgra la'o //🔽autpa ta nam kun nas skyes //

original: 'byung dang gyen du 'grod pa la //🔽autpa da ni kun nas bris //
analyzed: 'byung dang gyen du 'grod pa la // autpa da ni kun nas bris //
translated: The word utpatti means to arise and to ascend.🔽 The word utpādana means to draw out and to create.

original: legs par 'jug dang / 'byung don can //🔽au da yan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: legs par 'jug dang / 'byung don can // au da yan zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word udayāna means to enter well and to arise.

original: pat+sa'i rgyal dang bum pa skyes //
analyzed: pat+sa'i rgyal dang bum pa skyes //
translated: The word utpatti means to arise and to ascend.🔽 The word utpādana means to draw out and to create.

original: aud brta nam kun skyes dang // rnam par 'jug dang rnam par bris//🔽@204a * // audb'a ha ni /
analyzed: aud brta nam kun skyes dang // rnam par 'jug dang rnam par bris// @204a * // audb'a ha ni /

original: theg pa dang // gyen du 'dren dang dvi s'i tya //🔽au pa dh'a nam /
analyzed: theg pa dang // gyen du 'dren dang dvi s'i tya // au pa dh'a nam /

analyzed: ganda'i tog / khyad par dang ni pra na ya // au b'a sa nam /

original: 'da' goms dang // nyan par 'dod dang 'tshe ba la //
analyzed: 'da' goms dang // nyan par 'dod dang 'tshe ba la //

analyzed: kanytsu ki ni legs 'dul skyes // sprul dang dmar ser 'gro byed la //

analyzed: ka p'i ta ni shi r'i sha //

original: a'a mra dang ni khyad par gnas //
analyzed: a'a mra dang ni khyad par gnas //

original: gardha bhanda'i shing rnams la'o //🔽ka la dhva ni /
analyzed: gardha bhanda'i shing rnams la'o // ka la dhva ni /
translated: The word garbhābhaṇḍa means tree and to be full of fragrance.

original: ca co sgrogs //
analyzed: ca co sgrogs //

original: phug ron ne rtso rma bya'o //🔽ka la sin ni /
analyzed: phug ron ne rtso rma bya'o // ka la sin ni /
translated: The word kalasinha means bird and tree.🔽 The word kalasinha means bird and tree.🔽 The word kalasinha means bird and tree.🔽 The word kalasinha means bird and tree.🔽 The word kalasinha means bird and tree.🔽 The word kalasinha means bird and tree.

original: bya dang shing //
analyzed: bya dang shing //
translated: The word kalasinha means bird and tree.🔽 The word kalasinha

original: 'brug sgra'i rjes su sgeg pa la //
analyzed: 'brug sgra'i rjes su sgeg pa la //
translated: After the word thunder, beautiful.🔽Kātyāyana, supreme, desire,

original: k'a ty'a ya na mchog sred dang // dkar mo k'a tya'i bya mo dang // rgan po'i rnam pa ngur smrig gos //
analyzed: k'a ty'a ya na mchog sred dang // dkar mo k'a tya'i bya mo dang // rgan po'i rnam pa ngur smrig gos //

original: ku tsanda nam /
analyzed: ku tsanda nam /

original: tsandan dmar // 'dab ma ri lus dang shing dbye la //
analyzed: tsandan dmar // 'dab ma ri lus dang shing dbye la //

analyzed: kunda linma chu lha nyid // rma bya ri dags sprul rna rgyan //

analyzed: bum pa skyes ni ri byi dang // srid sgrub dang ni phur bu la //

analyzed: seng ge // klu //

analyzed: n'a ga ge sar rta rnams la //

original: kronytsa da nam //
analyzed: kronytsa da nam //

analyzed: ghinytsu l'i // tsinto ta ka padma'i rtsa //

analyzed: gha n'a gha na /

analyzed: char sprin dang // brgya byin dang ni glang po myos //

analyzed: gho sha yi tgu zhes bya ba //

analyzed: ne tso dang ni bram ze la //

analyzed: tsi tra bh'a nu bya dang me / tsol kin ni zha nye dang // lam ba dang ni kishku'i tshigs //

analyzed: dza l'a ta na 'jug pa dang// kram ka / kam ka khrag gi rgyun // dza la ta ni chu 'khor la //

analyzed: dza l'a ta ni chu gnas la //

analyzed: na la m'i na nya'i bye brag / ainyts'a ka dang byis pa gsod //

analyzed: bya bram ze //

original: glang po tho ba /

analyzed: r'u pam rnam pa mdzes rang bzhin //

analyzed: bu ga dang ni tshem bu la //

analyzed: pashpa mig chu rlangs ba la // shashpa rtsa gzhon so sor zas //

analyzed: sv'a ba nyal dang mi shes nyid //

analyzed: byug dang snyoms pa la yang ngo // aarna pa ni /

analyzed: see ri bha //

analyzed: chu rnams yang dag 'khrugs pa la //

analyzed: a'a kalpa ni khyim tsam dang // rtog par byed pa la yang ngo //

analyzed: / yongs 'dor aa la /

analyzed: 'gugs dang snyan dngags rgyan la'o //

analyzed: aa du pa ni zla ba gos //

original: au la ba ni /
analyzed: au la ba ni /
translated: Ula means

original: rtsa'i dbye ba //
analyzed: rtsa'i dbye ba //

original: aa la bam ni gel par 'dod //
analyzed: aa la bam ni gel par 'dod //

analyzed: gos dang ka si s'u ra dang // koo hi gnyis ka dag la'o //

analyzed: k'a shya p'i ni sa dang nya //

analyzed: ksha shyi pa ni /

analyzed: thub pa'i dbye //

analyzed: ku ta pa ni nga rgyal dbye //

analyzed: nishku ta dang thub pa la //

analyzed: batsh'i ri k'a la yang ngo //

original: tshad pa ra //
analyzed: tshad pa ra //

analyzed: la ba ku sha rol mo la'o // dzi hv'a ba ni khyi byi la //

analyzed: aa bhi r'u pa rtogs bya dang // dga' dang rab thob gzugs la'o //

analyzed: myur ba'i don can du 'dod do //

analyzed: au pa dza ma khyad par dang // dbye dang rnam par 'joms pa la //

analyzed: lhang tsher gong //

analyzed: chu dang chu la skyes pa la //

analyzed: // / ba ni chu lha nyer mjal rdzas //

original: bi tha ra ka ta 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bi tha ra ka ta 'bras bu'o //

original: kumbha gu gul shing dur byid //
analyzed: kumbha gu gul shing dur byid //

original: tsher can / pa nas //
analyzed: tsher can / pa nas //

original: dzambha / so dang / sgyur rtsi dang // lha min dbye dang za ba la //
analyzed: dzambha / so dang / sgyur rtsi dang // lha min dbye dang za ba la //

original: dzrinbha / kha gdangs @208b kha bya glal //
analyzed: dzrinbha / kha gdangs @208b kha bya glal //

original: da mbhi / b'a li sha dang byis //
analyzed: da mbhi / b'a li sha dang byis //

original: dambha tog can shing shun la //
analyzed: dambha tog can shing shun la //

original: drikbh'u sprul dang bdag po la //
analyzed: drikbh'u sprul dang bdag po la //

original: n'a bhi // rgyu skar 'khor lo sgyur /
analyzed: n'a bhi // rgyu skar 'khor lo sgyur /

original: gtso bo 'khor lo'i mtha' dang ni //
analyzed: gtso bo 'khor lo'i mtha' dang ni //

original: srog chags yan lag myos pa la //
analyzed: srog chags yan lag myos pa la //

original: ni bha 'dra ba thol la'o //🔽rambha 'od ma'i dbyugs pa la //
analyzed: ni bha 'dra ba thol la'o // rambha 'od ma'i dbyugs pa la //

analyzed: rambha chu shing chu skyes ma //

original: bi bhu sum rtsen dbang khyab bdag / shambhu dbang phyug tshangs pa dang // mchod 'os dang ni skra can ma //
analyzed: bi bhu sum rtsen dbang khyab bdag / shambhu dbang phyug tshangs pa dang // mchod 'os dang ni skra can ma //

original: shu bha grub pa shu bham bde //
analyzed: shu bha grub pa shu bham bde //

original: sho bha mdzes dang grib ma la //🔽sa bha / mdun /

original: pa / ba /
analyzed: pa / ba /

original: ba lang gnas //
analyzed: ba lang gnas //

original: rgyan po 'byed pa rta rag go //
analyzed: rgyan po 'byed pa rta rag go //

original: stambha bems po /
analyzed: stambha bems po /

original: ka ba la ;
analyzed: ka ba la ;
translated: [the word] śṛṅga for a horn, and [the word] śākhā for a branch.

analyzed: mam bzang / sdig can no // a'atm'a bh'u ni /
translated: [the word] aśubha for an inauspicious sign, [the word] akuśala for evil, and [the word] aku for a sinner.

original: 'dod lha tshangs //
analyzed: 'dod lha tshangs //
translated: [The word] ātmabhū is used for a desire god, [the word] brahma for Brahmā,

original: aa rambha ni //
analyzed: aa rambha ni //
translated: [the word] ārambha for a garden,

original: skyed tshal dang // dregs dang myur dang gsod pa la //🔽ri sha bha ni /
analyzed: skyed tshal dang // dregs dang myur dang gsod pa la // ri sha bha ni /

original: khyu mchog gtso bo //
analyzed: khyu mchog gtso bo //
translated: [The word] ṛṣabha is used for a bull, [the word] pravara for a chief,

original: sde tshan brgyad dang sman bye brag /
analyzed: sde tshan brgyad dang sman bye brag /
translated: and [the word] varga for a group.

analyzed: dbyangs kyi khyad par phag pa'i 'jug / bu ga rna ba dag la'o //

analyzed: risha bh'a mi yi rnam pa // bud med rnam mar btsun mo dang // rtse mo /

analyzed: byi la mchog gnas gtso //

original: ka ku pa ni srid sgrub shing //

translated: The dru is the seed, the ma is the tree, the ya is the wish-granting tree, and the sa is the human.🔽What is the ya?🔽 The dha is harmlessness, the rma is merit, the rigs is sacrifice, the pa is nature, the dpe is example, the dum is summary, the kun spyod is conduct, the rigs byed is poetry, the mtha' is the end, and the zhu is the ear.🔽The shi ba'i btung ba is the medicine itself.🔽 The dri'i rtsa is the cool, the dul byed is the name, and the gzhan bstod is the praise of others.🔽 The na mi is the well, the khon pa is the mouth, the ti ni is the flesh, the sha is the tree, and the 'khor lo'i mtha' is the end of the wheel.🔽

analyzed: ka byam chad dang lcag 'os dang // bar ma dang ni lcags rnams la //

analyzed: sked chings dang ni glang po'i so //

analyzed: rol mo'i bye brag la yang ngo //

analyzed: tsa bya dpen ba tsa by'a ni /

analyzed: dga' ba 'ching ba'i khyad par la //
translated: The special binding of joy is

analyzed: bden pa dang ni rung ba la //

analyzed: k'a me yam ni dus dum bu // ku l'a ya ni sngon po bzhin //

analyzed: 'dab chags sngon po dang ni gnas //

analyzed: @213b koo kri tya ni rjes su gdung //

original: mi rig byed pa dag la'o //
analyzed: mi rig byed pa dag la'o //

original: g'am ge yam ni mu sta ka / gser dang ka ste ru sha'o //
analyzed: g'am ge yam ni mu sta ka / gser dang ka ste ru sha'o //
translated: gold, and the arrow.🔽Gaṃ geyam is the class,

analyzed: g'am ge ya ni sde tshan dang // 'jigs sde dang ni g'am ga'i bu //

original: tsakshu she ni ka ti ka //
analyzed: tsakshu she ni ka ti ka //

original: pad dkar shing dang mig sman bcud //
analyzed: pad dkar shing dang mig sman bcud //

analyzed: ku sha lyam ni skal bzang dang // mig la phan pa'o tsa mbi ya ;

original: / shya pa ka dang 'jig byed mda' //
analyzed: / shya pa ka dang 'jig byed mda' //
translated: is the śyāpaka and the arrow of destruction.

original: me tog ge ser gser la'o //
analyzed: me tog ge ser gser la'o //
translated: Puṣpa is the lotus and gold.

original: dza gha nyam ni tha ma smod //🔽lhag ma'o dza t'a yu bya'i dbye //🔽gu gul shing ngo ta pa sy'a //🔽tshangs spyod dka' thub skar ma dbo //🔽de ba yu ni chos ldan dang // de ba y'a tri ka la'o //🔽dvi t'i y'a ni ches dbye dang // sa le rdzogs par byed pa la'o //🔽n'a de yi ni rgyal ma dang // sba yi dzambu chu'i lcang ma //🔽n'i ka ya ni bdag nyid khyim //🔽dza b'a ni rangga gi gushtha //🔽chos mthun nges 'bab mtshon cha dang // 'dus pa dang ni 'dres pa la'o //🔽nyee pa thyam ni tshos byed pa //🔽rab tu sgrub par byed pa la //
analyzed: dza gha nyam ni tha ma smod // lhag ma'o dza t'a yu bya'i dbye // gu gul shing ngo ta pa sy'a // tshangs spyod dka' thub skar ma dbo // de ba yu ni chos ldan dang // de ba y'a tri ka la'o // dvi t'i y'a ni ches dbye dang // sa le rdzogs par byed pa la'o // n'a de yi ni rgyal ma dang // sba yi dzambu chu'i lcang ma // n'i ka ya ni bdag nyid khyim // dza b'a ni rangga gi gushtha // chos mthun nges 'bab mtshon cha dang // 'dus pa dang ni 'dres pa la'o // nyee pa thyam ni tshos byed pa // rab tu sgrub par byed pa la //
translated: Jhagganiya is the lowest, the worst.🔽The rest are divided into Jati and Uva.🔽Guduli is a tree.🔽Tapasi is chastity, asceticism.🔽Devayuni is righteous, and Devayatrika.🔽Dvitiyani is a division, and Salini is that which brings to an end.🔽Nadi is a river, and Baya is a bamboo.🔽Nika is one's own house.🔽Javana is one's own fist.🔽Dharani is a weapon that falls in accordance with the Dharma, and Samgati is a gathering, and Samgati is a mixture.🔽Nyepa is that which cooks.🔽Pra-siddha is that which establishes.🔽

original: ba ya sya ni'o thug dang // mdog bzang 'o ma bzhon ma dang // 'o ma phan pa'o par++ya dang // gnas dang 'brug sgra sgra 'byin la //
analyzed: ba ya sya ni'o thug dang // mdog bzang 'o ma bzhon ma dang // 'o ma phan pa'o par++ya dang // gnas dang 'brug sgra sgra 'byin la //
translated: Jha is the lowest, the end, the last, the tail, the remainder, the end of the hair, the end of the beard, the end of the nails, the end of the teeth, the end of the hair on the body, the end of the skin, the end of the flesh, the end of the sinews, the end of the bones, the end of the marrow, the end of the kidneys, the end of the heart, the end of the liver, the end of the lungs, the end of the spleen, the end of the intestines, the end of the mesentery, the end of the undigested food, the end of the feces, the end of the bile, the end of the phlegm, the end of the pus, the end of the blood, the end of the grease, the end of the fat, the end of the tears, the end of the sweat, the end of the saliva, the end of the mucus, the end of the fluid of the joints, the end of the urine, the end of the semen, the end of the head, the end of the neck, the end of the shoulders, the end of the arms, the end of the hands, the end of the fingers, the end of the nails, the end of the back, the end of the chest, the end of the belly, the end of the hips, the end of the thighs, the end of the calves, the end of the feet, the end of the toes, the end of the nails, the end of the earth, the end of water, the end of fire, the end of wind, the end of space, the end of consciousness, the end of form, the end of feeling, the end of discrimination, the end of compositional factors, the end of consciousness, the end of the eye,

original: par++y'a ya ni rnam grangs dang // sbrul pa rab 'byed mda' la'o //
analyzed: par++y'a ya ni rnam grangs dang // sbrul pa rab 'byed mda' la'o //
translated: Parāyaṇa is a synonym, and Pravāraṇā is the opening of the rains retreat.

original: s'a n'i ya ni btung bya chu //
analyzed: s'a n'i ya ni btung bya chu //
translated: Sānnāyaka is the one who is to be invited for a meal.

original: b'a ru sha ni phur bu la //
analyzed: b'a ru sha ni phur bu la //
translated: Vāruṣa is a sacrificial stake.

original: b'a ru shyam ni rtsub pa dang // brgya byin gyi ni tshal la'ang yang ;
analyzed: b'a ru shyam ni rtsub pa dang // brgya byin gyi ni tshal la'ang yang ;
translated: Vāruṣya is rough, and also the garden of Indra.

original: / pu lapdya ni mi ci'i dbang //
analyzed: / pu lapdya ni mi ci'i dbang //
translated: Pulastya is the lord of the Kinnaras.

original: 'od yangs tsha'o mgrin bcu la //
analyzed: 'od yangs tsha'o mgrin bcu la //
translated: Pulaha is the one with vast light, and the one with ten necks.

original: bra k'i r++ye ni lag skyes rul //
analyzed: bra k'i r++ye ni lag skyes rul //
translated: Prakṛti is the rotten hand.

original: cho ga nges par bkram pa la //
analyzed: cho ga nges par bkram pa la //
translated: In the ritual, it is the spreading.

original: pra na ya ni dga' ba dang // bi shrambha dang slong ba la //
analyzed: pra na ya ni dga' ba dang // bi shrambha dang slong ba la //
translated: Pranaya is joy, and Viśrambha is begging.

original: pra n'a ya ni sreg la 'dor //
analyzed: pra n'a ya ni sreg la 'dor //
translated: Prāṇāya is the offering into the fire.

original: yang dag mi 'dod mngon par brjod //
analyzed: yang dag mi 'dod mngon par brjod //
translated: It is also the expression of what is not desired.

original: pra tya ya ni mna' gtan tshigs //
analyzed: pra tya ya ni mna' gtan tshigs //
translated: Pratyaya is an oath, a pledge.

original: shes dang yid rton nges pa dang // s'i nt'a di khy'a ta t'a dang // bu ga gnas spyod rag las la'o //
analyzed: shes dang yid rton nges pa dang // s'i nt'a di khy'a ta t'a dang // bu ga gnas spyod rag las la'o //
translated: Jñāna, śraddhā, niścaya, and sāntidhi are for the one who is in a hole, who is engaged, and who is dependent.

original: pra ma ya mchi bskal pa'i mtha' //
analyzed: pra ma ya mchi bskal pa'i mtha' //
translated: Pramāya is the end of the eon.

original: brgyal bar gyur pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: brgyal bar gyur pa rnams la'o //
translated: It is for those who have fainted.

original: pra pa bya ni lam mthun dang // rang bzhin ldan pa'o //
analyzed: pra pa bya ni lam mthun dang // rang bzhin ldan pa'o //
translated: Prapaṇya is the path, and it is natural.

original: pa la ya //🔽gdu bum mgul nad /
analyzed: pa la ya // gdu bum mgul nad /
translated: Palāśa.

original: kam ka na //
analyzed: kam ka na //
translated: Kamkana.

original: b'a le ya ni banydzi k'a / bod bu ba si hi ta pa //
analyzed: b'a le ya ni banydzi k'a / bod bu ba si hi ta pa //
translated: Vāleya, banyaka, bodhu, vasitapa,

original: bra hma n+ya ni sa nu dang // bri sha tshangs pa'i legs pa la //
analyzed: bra hma n+ya ni sa nu dang // bri sha tshangs pa'i legs pa la //
translated: Brahmaṇya, sanu, and briśa.

original: brahma nyam ni bram ze dang // bram ze rnams kyi tshogs pa la //
analyzed: brahma nyam ni bram ze dang // bram ze rnams kyi tshogs pa la //
translated: Brahmaṇyaṃ, brāhmaṇa, and the assembly of brāhmaṇas.

original: bhu dzi shya ni grogs ngan dang // lag pa'i srad bu'o bhu dzi shy'a //
analyzed: bhu dzi shya ni grogs ngan dang // lag pa'i srad bu'o bhu dzi shy'a //
translated: Bhujya, bad friend, and the wrist, bhuja.

original: rag lus man dang rje rigs bran //🔽bh'u sh'a tsyu ni 'od @214a * //
analyzed: rag lus man dang rje rigs bran // bh'u sh'a tsyu ni 'od @214a * //
translated: Rāghava, kṣatriya, and servant.🔽Bhūṣā, cūṇa, and mahāprabhā.

original: chen 'dod // bsil pa'i 'od zer rnams la'o //
analyzed: chen 'dod // bsil pa'i 'od zer rnams la'o //
translated: Śītaprabhā, and the rays.

original: bhr'a tri bya ni /
analyzed: bhr'a tri bya ni /
translated: Bhāratī,

original: sbun zla'i / thu //🔽mam ga lyam ni zho bkra shis //
analyzed: sbun zla'i / thu // mam ga lyam ni zho bkra shis //
translated: and the sister of the husband.🔽Mangalyā, curd, and auspicious.

original: yid 'ong la'o mangga ly'am //
analyzed: yid 'ong la'o mangga ly'am //
translated: Manāpya, and the beloved.

original: dpal 'bras dang ni aa shva dtha //
analyzed: dpal 'bras dang ni aa shva dtha //
translated: Śrīphala, and aśvattha.

original: ma s'u r'a dang skyob byed la //
analyzed: ma s'u r'a dang skyob byed la //
translated: Māṃsāra, and trāyate.🔽Mangalyā, and candrā.

original: mam ga ly'am ni gsal ma dang // me tog brgya pa bri yang gu //
analyzed: mam ga ly'am ni gsal ma dang // me tog brgya pa bri yang gu //
translated: Puṣpam, and śata.

original: thur bltas me tog zhi ma dkar //
analyzed: thur bltas me tog zhi ma dkar //
translated: Adhomukha, and puṣpa.🔽Śveta, and śaṅkha.

original: dung gi me tog shu dag rnams //
analyzed: dung gi me tog shu dag rnams //
translated: Puṣpa, and utpala.

original: ma la ya ni yul ri'i dbye //
analyzed: ma la ya ni yul ri'i dbye //
translated: Malaya is a mountain region.

original: kun dga' ra dang ri yi cha //
analyzed: kun dga' ra dang ri yi cha //
translated: Nandana and Riksha are mountains.

original: dur byid la yang ma la y'a //
analyzed: dur byid la yang ma la y'a //
translated: Mandara is also Malaya.

original: mri g-yu ni bram zer brjod //
analyzed: mri g-yu ni bram zer brjod //
translated: Mrigavyadha is said to be a brahmin.

original: go ma mu ni nad dag la //
analyzed: go ma mu ni nad dag la //
translated: Gomukha is a disease.

original: ra ha sya ni sba bya la //
analyzed: ra ha sya ni sba bya la //
translated: Rahasyam is a secret.

original: ra ha sy'a ni chu bo'i dbye //
analyzed: ra ha sy'a ni chu bo'i dbye //
translated: Rahasyam is a division of the Ganges.🔽Lohitya is red.

original: lo hi dyam ni dmar po dang // 'bru dang chu bo'i khyad par la //🔽bakta bya ni smod dang dman //
analyzed: lo hi dyam ni dmar po dang // 'bru dang chu bo'i khyad par la // bakta bya ni smod dang dman //
translated: Vakta is a grain and a river.

original: rag las pa'o ma d'a hya //
analyzed: rag las pa'o ma d'a hya //
translated: Ragata is dependence.🔽Madhu is good speech and cutting.

original: ngag bzang po dang gcod byed dang // rnam par rgyal dang rgyal ba'i lam //🔽bi dza ya ni goo r'i dang // de yi grogs mo chos dbye la //
analyzed: ngag bzang po dang gcod byed dang // rnam par rgyal dang rgyal ba'i lam // bi dza ya ni goo r'i dang // de yi grogs mo chos dbye la //
translated: Vijaya is the path of victory.🔽Vijaya is the path of victory.

original: bi na ya ni drul dang lugs //
analyzed: bi na ya ni drul dang lugs //
translated: Vinaya is wool and a sheep.

original: dra ba la'o bi sha lya //
analyzed: dra ba la'o bi sha lya //
translated: Visalya is a net.

original: mo yi gtsug phud glang po dang // gu d'u tsi dang dur byid dang // zug rngu bral ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: mo yi gtsug phud glang po dang // gu d'u tsi dang dur byid dang // zug rngu bral ba la yang ngo //
translated: Moshika is an elephant, a friend of hers, and a division of the Dharma.

original: bisma ya ni rmad byung snyems //
analyzed: bisma ya ni rmad byung snyems //
translated: Vismaya is amazement.

original: bi sha ya ni spyod lam yul //
analyzed: bi sha ya ni spyod lam yul //
translated: Vishaya is the object of conduct.

original: dbang po'i don la'ang nges par 'jug /'brel pa sogs kyi shes pa'ang dran //
analyzed: dbang po'i don la'ang nges par 'jug /'brel pa sogs kyi shes pa'ang dran //
translated: The word indriya is used for the objects of the senses, and for the consciousnesses of the sense faculties, etc.

original: bya b'a ya ni rab dga' dang // mi snang ba la yang dag dran //
analyzed: bya b'a ya ni rab dga' dang // mi snang ba la yang dag dran //
translated: The word kriyā is used for pramuditā, and for adarśana.

original: bya b'a yam ni gzi brjid la //🔽shinda yam ni //
analyzed: bya b'a yam ni gzi brjid la // shinda yam ni //
translated: The word tejas is used for kriyā.🔽The word śubha is used for śubhakṛtsna.

original: thub pa'i dbye //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbye //
translated: The word muni is used for the divisions of the Sage.

original: dpal 'bras dag byed khyad par la //
analyzed: dpal 'bras dag byed khyad par la //
translated: The word śrī is used for the special fruit of virtue.

original: sh'a lya yam ni me tog brgya //
analyzed: sh'a lya yam ni me tog brgya //
translated: The word śālya is used for the hundred flowers.

original: sha'o skyes pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sha'o skyes pa la yang ngo //
translated: The word śālya is also used for a man.

original: shr'irsha n+ya ni rnam par rgyas //
analyzed: shr'irsha n+ya ni rnam par rgyas //
translated: The word śrīvatsa is used for the prosperous.

original: skra dang rtse mo can la'o //
analyzed: skra dang rtse mo can la'o //
translated: The word śikhī is used for one with hair on the head.

original: shee le yam ni rgya mtsho'i tsha //
analyzed: shee le yam ni rgya mtsho'i tsha //
translated: The word śaila is used for the ocean.

original: ta la'i 'dab dang brag skyes la //
analyzed: ta la'i 'dab dang brag skyes la //
translated: The word tālavṛtta is used for palm leaves and for rock.🔽The word śaśi is used for mother-in-law, for pot, and for śāli.

original: shva shur++y++ya sgyug mo dang // bum pa dang ni shy'a le ka / panna ya ni rgyab gnas dang // stobs dang lugs dang 'du ba'o //
analyzed: shva shur++y++ya sgyug mo dang // bum pa dang ni shy'a le ka / panna ya ni rgyab gnas dang // stobs dang lugs dang 'du ba'o //
translated: The word paṇḍya is used for the back, for strength, for the veins, and for the joints.

original: sa ma ya ni grub mtha' dang // mna' dang kun spyod yang dag rig / des bstan bya ba'i rnam pa dang // dus dang brda rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: sa ma ya ni grub mtha' dang // mna' dang kun spyod yang dag rig / des bstan bya ba'i rnam pa dang // dus dang brda rnams la yang ngo //
translated: The word samaya is used for conclusion, for oath, for conduct, and for right knowledge, and for the aspects of what is taught by that, and for time and convention.

original: sa randyu ni chu sbyin dang // rlung dang nus pa /
analyzed: sa randyu ni chu sbyin dang // rlung dang nus pa /
translated: Sarandhyu is for water-giving, wind, and power.

original: rung ba stobs //
analyzed: rung ba stobs //
translated: Ruk is for suitability and strength.

original: boo kar++y++yam ni aa n'a ya pa //
analyzed: boo kar++y++yam ni aa n'a ya pa //
translated: Boukaryam is for the act of not bringing.

original: phag gi bya ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: phag gi bya ba la yang ngo //
translated: It is also for the act of a pig.

original: soo ra bhyam ni dri bzang dang // mdzes dang yon tan gus pa la'o //
analyzed: soo ra bhyam ni dri bzang dang // mdzes dang yon tan gus pa la'o //
translated: Sourbhyam is for good smell, beauty, virtue, and respect.

original: sam stya ya ni kun tu 'jug / dbyibs @214b dang rgya che mgrin pa la //
analyzed: sam stya ya ni kun tu 'jug / dbyibs @214b dang rgya che mgrin pa la //
translated: Samstya is for complete engagement, shape, vastness, and neck.

original: ti ra nyam ni mi zad rdzas //
analyzed: ti ra nyam ni mi zad rdzas //
translated: Tiranyam is for inexhaustible substance.

original: mchog dang gser dang khu ba dang // nga rgyal dbye ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: mchog dang gser dang khu ba dang // nga rgyal dbye ba la yang ngo //
translated: It is also for supreme, gold, semen, and the division of pride.

original: hri de yam ni snying po snying //
analyzed: hri de yam ni snying po snying //
translated: Hridayam is for essence and heart.

original: kshi pa nyam ni dri zhim lus //
analyzed: kshi pa nyam ni dri zhim lus //
translated: Kshipanyam is for fragrant body.

original: kshi tra ya ni gzhan lus dang // gso spyad 'os dang zhing dang rtsa //
analyzed: kshi tra ya ni gzhan lus dang // gso spyad 'os dang zhing dang rtsa //
translated: Kshityam is for another's body, what is to be cured, field, and grass.

original: gzhan gyi chung ma dga' ba dang // bsgrub bya dang ni nad dag la //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma dga' ba dang // bsgrub bya dang ni nad dag la //
translated: It is also for another's wife, pleasure, what is to be accomplished, and diseases.

original: aa nu sha ya rjes su gdung //
analyzed: aa nu sha ya rjes su gdung //
translated: Anushaya is for subsequent torment.

original: rjes su 'brel dang zhes dang la //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel dang zhes dang la //

original: aanta sha y++ya 'chi ba dang // sa yi mal dang dur khrod ma //
analyzed: aanta sha y++ya 'chi ba dang // sa yi mal dang dur khrod ma //

original: g-yas bral g-yas min mi mthun pa //🔽aa ba bya na snyems ni na //
analyzed: g-yas bral g-yas min mi mthun pa // aa ba bya na snyems ni na //
translated: The right, the left, the opposite, the contrary,🔽The humble, the proud,

original: au pa k'a r++ya mi bdag gnas //
analyzed: au pa k'a r++ya mi bdag gnas //
translated: The king, the minister,

original: phan par byed pa'i dbye ba la //
analyzed: phan par byed pa'i dbye ba la //
translated: The beneficial, the harmful,🔽The Katra, the Veya, the Janya,

original: k'a tra be ya zha nye dang // sha tshe dang ni mtshon dag la //🔽au ba kra ya gso spyad dang // rtsom pa dang ni gsod pa la //
analyzed: k'a tra be ya zha nye dang // sha tshe dang ni mtshon dag la // au ba kra ya gso spyad dang // rtsom pa dang ni gsod pa la //

original: zla ba'i na tshod bla re dang // bdag nyid dang ni sman gyi dbye //
analyzed: zla ba'i na tshod bla re dang // bdag nyid dang ni sman gyi dbye //
translated: The self, the medicine,🔽The Jalasaya, the water,

original: dz'a l'a sha ya chu yig ni //🔽ji la sha yam 'dam bu sbyin//
analyzed: dz'a l'a sha ya chu yig ni // ji la sha yam 'dam bu sbyin//
translated: The Jalasaya, the reed, the gift,

original: tantu li ya byi dong ga'i //
analyzed: tantu li ya byi dong ga'i //

original: shing dang chung du m'a ri la //
analyzed: shing dang chung du m'a ri la //

original: gdung ba rtsa dang stong pa dang // ka ta ka'i 'bras phreng ba yangs //
analyzed: gdung ba rtsa dang stong pa dang // ka ta ka'i 'bras phreng ba yangs //
translated: The fever, the vein, the void, the Kataka, the fruit, the garland,

original: dha nam dza ya rta dang lus //
analyzed: dha nam dza ya rta dang lus //

original: glang po rlung me ka ku bha //
analyzed: glang po rlung me ka ku bha //

analyzed: ni ra ma ya skyon med rtog / pa ri b'a ma chu yi gnas //
translated: The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namatva, the covering,

original: nam ta mba dang // yongs su bkab //
analyzed: nam ta mba dang // yongs su bkab //
translated: The Namatva, the covering,🔽The Namat

original: p'anytsa dza n+ya hri th'i ka sha / dung dang b'a ta ga la'o //
analyzed: p'anytsa dza n+ya hri th'i ka sha / dung dang b'a ta ga la'o //
translated: śaṅkhavaṭagolakaḥ.

original: boo ru she ya skyes bu'i rtsal //
analyzed: boo ru she ya skyes bu'i rtsal //
translated: vīraśauryaṃ puruṣakṣaḥ,

original: tshig dbye tshogs ba gsod pa dang // skyes bus byas pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: tshig dbye tshogs ba gsod pa dang // skyes bus byas pa rnams la'o //

original: bi ta b'a yam 'jigs pa dang // 'jigs rung pra ti shra ma ni //
analyzed: bi ta b'a yam 'jigs pa dang // 'jigs rung pra ti shra ma ni //

original: 'dun sa dang ni gnas la'o //
analyzed: 'dun sa dang ni gnas la'o //
translated: sabhā-sthānaṃ ca.

original: pha lam da ya 'bras bu rnams //
analyzed: pha lam da ya 'bras bu rnams //
translated: phalaṃ dadāti phalāni ca,

original: 'byung dang rnyed dang sum rtsen la //
analyzed: 'byung dang rnyed dang sum rtsen la //
translated: utpatti-lābha-svarga-

original: pi le sha ya byis ba sprul //
analyzed: pi le sha ya byis ba sprul //
translated: pilāśaśca bāla-nirmāṇaṃ,

original: bh'a ga dhe yam skal ba dang // lag pa dang ni cha la'o //
analyzed: bh'a ga dhe yam skal ba dang // lag pa dang ni cha la'o //
translated: bhāgadheyaṃ bhāga-hasta-bhāgaśca.

original: bhri tandri ya byed pa dang // sgra dang spyod yul 'dus pa la //
analyzed: bhri tandri ya byed pa dang // sgra dang spyod yul 'dus pa la //
translated: kṛtiḥ śabda-gocara-saṃyogaḥ,

original: ma hod y++ya kun 'byung dang // byang grol du mo rgur mo la //
analyzed: ma hod y++ya kun 'byung dang // byang grol du mo rgur mo la //
translated: mahāyūhaḥ samudaya-nirvāṇa-dūrmukha-dūṣitaḥ,

original: ya h'a lam gtsug lag khang //
analyzed: ya h'a lam gtsug lag khang //
translated: yajñālayaḥ,

original: mu stegs khang dang mchog bdag la //
analyzed: mu stegs khang dang mchog bdag la //
translated: tīrtha-śālā-śreṣṭha-svāmī ca.

original: ma h'a m'u lyi rin thang che //
analyzed: ma h'a m'u lyi rin thang che //
translated: mahāmūlyā mahā-ratnaṃ,

original: padma r'a ga la sogs la //
analyzed: padma r'a ga la sogs la //
translated: padmarāga-ādayaśca.

original: m'adz'a ri ya dmangs rigs dang // byi la bya ba spyod pa la //
analyzed: m'adz'a ri ya dmangs rigs dang // byi la bya ba spyod pa la //
translated: In the case of the low-caste and cat, the action is indicated.

original: ra te nya ya rab 'phyang gsod //
analyzed: ra te nya ya rab 'phyang gsod //
translated: In the case of hanging and killing, the object is indicated.

original: lhag pa dang ni ne'u le //🔽sa mutstsha ya sbring dang 'gog / sa mu d'a ya @215a * //
analyzed: lhag pa dang ni ne'u le // sa mutstsha ya sbring dang 'gog / sa mu d'a ya @215a * //
translated: In the case of extra and monkey, the quality is indicated.

original: tshogs pa dang // kun tu sbyor dang nye ba'i rim //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang // kun tu sbyor dang nye ba'i rim //
translated: In the case of assembly and union, the relation is indicated.

original: sa m'u d'a ya tshogs brid sgra //
analyzed: sa m'u d'a ya tshogs brid sgra //
translated: In the case of gathering and entanglement, the sound is indicated.

original: samba ra ya g-yul 'gyed dang // rgud dang phyi ma'i dus dag la //
analyzed: samba ra ya g-yul 'gyed dang // rgud dang phyi ma'i dus dag la //
translated: In the case of battle and decline, the time is indicated.

original: sa langga ya sgra dang ming //
analyzed: sa langga ya sgra dang ming //
translated: In the case of sound and name, the word is indicated.

original: rol rtsed phyugs dang bya dag la //
analyzed: rol rtsed phyugs dang bya dag la //
translated: In the case of play and cattle, the animal is indicated.

original: sthu'u lotstsha ya mtha' dag ni //
analyzed: sthu'u lotstsha ya mtha' dag ni //
translated: In the case of all and entire, the measure is indicated.

original: shing dum rdo ba za ma tog //
analyzed: shing dum rdo ba za ma tog //
translated: In the case of stump and stone, the substance is indicated.

original: glang po rnams kyi bar ma la//🔽aa ku to bha yam zhes pa //
analyzed: glang po rnams kyi bar ma la// aa ku to bha yam zhes pa //
translated: In the case of elephant and middle, the comparison is indicated.🔽In the case of akutobhaya, the temple is indicated.

original: lha khang aa k'indi sh'ika / k'a l'a nu p'ar++yam ni shing //
analyzed: lha khang aa k'indi sh'ika / k'a l'a nu p'ar++yam ni shing //
translated: In the case of kalānuparāya, the tree is indicated.

original: shi sha ba dang dus skyes dang // ri las skyes pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: shi sha ba dang dus skyes dang // ri las skyes pa rnams la'o //
translated: In the case of śiśupāla and jātakā, the mountain is indicated.

original: dugbha t'a l'i yang zhes pa //
analyzed: dugbha t'a l'i yang zhes pa //
translated: In the case of dugbhāṭṭī, the tree is indicated.

original: a'a ma'i 'o ma 'o ma'is //
analyzed: a'a ma'i 'o ma 'o ma'is //
translated: In the case of āmikṣā, the milk is indicated.

original: dbu ba can dang de nas ni //
analyzed: dbu ba can dang de nas ni //
translated: (1) the one with foam, and then🔽(2) the one with milk,🔽(3) the one with curd,

original: 'o ma'i tsam sa dang ni //
analyzed: 'o ma'i tsam sa dang ni //
translated: (4) the one with fresh butter,🔽(5) the one with clarified butter,

original: ta ta panda k'i ta'o //🔽pra ba tsa n'i ya zhes pa //
analyzed: ta ta panda k'i ta'o // pra ba tsa n'i ya zhes pa //
translated: (6) the one with the essence of clarified butter,🔽(7) the one with the essence of the essence of clarified butter,

original: brjod bya'i rab dang rjod byed rab //🔽pri sha ka b'a y'i zhes pa //🔽dpal mo go rim 'tsho byed ma //🔽brgya las mchog tu gyur ma'o //
analyzed: brjod bya'i rab dang rjod byed rab // pri sha ka b'a y'i zhes pa // dpal mo go rim 'tsho byed ma // brgya las mchog tu gyur ma'o //
translated: (8) the one with the essence of the essence of the essence of clarified butter,

original: pa tyungga ma n'i yam ni //
analyzed: pa tyungga ma n'i yam ni //
translated: (9) the one with the essence of the essence of the essence of the essence of clarified butter,

original: nye bar gnas bya sbyang pa'i gos //
analyzed: nye bar gnas bya sbyang pa'i gos //
translated: (10) the one with the essence of the essence of the essence of the essence of the essence of clarified butter,

original: bi shva ksen bri y'a ni //🔽padma ma dang skyob byed la //
analyzed: bi shva ksen bri y'a ni // padma ma dang skyob byed la //
translated: (11) the one with the essence of the essence of the essence of the essence of the essence of the essence of clarified butter,

analyzed: ghr'a ni sna dang snom byed dang // dra ni shing dang nyin mo dang // gser dang 'dod pa'i gzugs can la //

original: shr'i ni dpal mo dbyangs can dang // mdzes dang shes rab thang shing dang // 'jug pa sde gsum phun tshogs dang // cha lugs dang ni phan byed dang // sru ni 'dzag dang chu 'bab sgra //
analyzed: shr'i ni dpal mo dbyangs can dang // mdzes dang shes rab thang shing dang // 'jug pa sde gsum phun tshogs dang // cha lugs dang ni phan byed dang // sru ni 'dzag dang chu 'bab sgra //
translated: Śrī is Sarasvatī, and Śrī is also beauty, wisdom, a banyan tree, an entrance, a group of three, perfection, dress, and a benefactor.

original: hri ni / bi da ngo tsha la //
analyzed: hri ni / bi da ngo tsha la //
translated: Hrī is shame.

original: aa gram gtso bo mchog dang ni //
analyzed: aa gram gtso bo mchog dang ni //
translated: Aṅga is the chief, the best,

original: rtse mor gyur dang lhag pa sogs //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur dang lhag pa sogs //
translated: the summit, the remainder, and so forth.

original: mdun dang stobs dang nga rgyal dang // bram ze mdzes dang 'od dag la //
analyzed: mdun dang stobs dang nga rgyal dang // bram ze mdzes dang 'od dag la //
translated: Aṅga is also in front, strength, pride, a brahmin, beauty, and light.

original: mchod dang 'degs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: mchod dang 'degs pa dag la'o //
translated: Aṅga is also worship and lifting.

original: aangga ma sri mbe kh'andi sva rno //
analyzed: aangga ma sri mbe kh'andi sva rno //
translated: Aṅga is also a sword, a staff, a cane, and a sharp weapon.

original: ma dho ri he ri skyes la'ang ngo //
analyzed: ma dho ri he ri skyes la'ang ngo //
translated: Aṅga is also the middle, the end, and the beginning.

original: rantra myur ba 'khyogs lus dang // myur bar 'gro ba dag la'o //
analyzed: rantra myur ba 'khyogs lus dang // myur bar 'gro ba dag la'o //
translated: Aṅga is also a swift-flowing river, a swift-flowing stream, and a swift-flowing current.

original: aa shram dmar dang gsol la'o //
analyzed: aa shram dmar dang gsol la'o //
translated: Aṅga is also red and eating.

original: aa shra zur dang skra la'o //
analyzed: aa shra zur dang skra la'o //
translated: Aṅga is also a corner and hair.

original: aa stram mtshon cha gzhug nas phyin //🔽a'a r'a pags pa 'bigs pa la //
analyzed: aa stram mtshon cha gzhug nas phyin // a'a r'a pags pa 'bigs pa la //
translated: Aṅga is also a weapon, and one who has gone forth with a weapon.🔽Aṅga is also a flayer.

original: a'a r'a sa skyes sben pa la //
analyzed: a'a r'a sa skyes sben pa la //
translated: Aṅga is also a son of Ārā.

original: aa ru shing gi dbye ba dang // spe'u dang ni mche ba can //
analyzed: aa ru shing gi dbye ba dang // spe'u dang ni mche ba can //
translated: The different kinds of myrobalan, and the pomegranate.

original: aindra brgya byin mun pa nyid //
analyzed: aindra brgya byin mun pa nyid //
translated: Indra, Śakra, and darkness.

original: rnal 'byor dbang po gdengs ka la //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang po gdengs ka la //
translated: The lord of yogins, hood, and the moon.

original: ai ra bcud dang 'khor dang 'dzin //
analyzed: ai ra bcud dang 'khor dang 'dzin //
translated: The essence, retinue, and holder.

original: mi mnyam pa yis rnams la //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa yis rnams la //
translated: The unequalled ones.

original: au gra drag go bod pa dang // dmangs rigs bu dang 'phrog byed la //🔽au gra shu nag sbrid pa @215b dang ; / rnga mo glang mo che mo la //
analyzed: au gra drag go bod pa dang // dmangs rigs bu dang 'phrog byed la // au gra shu nag sbrid pa @215b dang ; / rnga mo glang mo che mo la //
translated: The ogre, the strong, the Tibetan, the śūdra, the son, and the robber.🔽The ogre, the black, the numbness, and the camel, the female elephant, the large female.

original: aushti pa lang skyong ma la //
analyzed: aushti pa lang skyong ma la //
translated: The cowherd.

original: au sra 'od la au sr'a ni //
analyzed: au sra 'od la au sr'a ni //
translated: The light, the light-possessor.

original: ba lang steng skyob dag la'o //
analyzed: ba lang steng skyob dag la'o //
translated: The bull, the protector.

original: aee ndri bya rog rgyal byed la //🔽ae dra dza p'a'i shing dang ni //
analyzed: aee ndri bya rog rgyal byed la // ae dra dza p'a'i shing dang ni //
translated: The crow, the victor.

original: chang gi khyad par dag la'o //
analyzed: chang gi khyad par dag la'o //
translated: The tree, the liquor.

original: aamghri rkang pa pram thu bo //
analyzed: aamghri rkang pa pram thu bo //
translated: The foot, the eldest.

original: ka dru gser dang ser skya la //
analyzed: ka dru gser dang ser skya la //
translated: The bee, the gold, the tawny.

original: ka ri lag pa 'od char rdo //
analyzed: ka ri lag pa 'od char rdo //
translated: The hand, the light, the stone.

original: k'a ra bsad pa ma mo ri //
analyzed: k'a ra bsad pa ma mo ri //
translated: The killing, the mother.

original: nges dang so sor 'bad pa dang // stobs ldan la'o s'a r'a ni //
analyzed: nges dang so sor 'bad pa dang // stobs ldan la'o s'a r'a ni //
translated: The certain, the individual, the exertion, the powerful.

original: gnyen dang grong khyer 'ching ba dang // gser dang byas pa gzir ba dang // pho nya mo dang rab bsten pa //🔽k'a ru bzab dang // byed pa po dang las kun pa //
analyzed: gnyen dang grong khyer 'ching ba dang // gser dang byas pa gzir ba dang // pho nya mo dang rab bsten pa // k'a ru bzab dang // byed pa po dang las kun pa //
translated: (1) relatives, (2) city, (3) fetters, (4) gold, (5) work, (6) threat, (7) messenger, (8) service,🔽(9) excellent kāraṇa, (10) agent, (11) all actions,

original: k'a ri bya ba n'a pi ta //
analyzed: k'a ri bya ba n'a pi ta //
translated: (12) kāri, (13) work, (14) not,

original: k'i ra ljongs dang ne tso la /
analyzed: k'i ra ljongs dang ne tso la /
translated: (15) kīra, (16) country, (17) parrot,

original: ku ru mi bdag khyad par zas //
analyzed: ku ru mi bdag khyad par zas //
translated: (18) kuru, (19) lord of men, (20) special food,

original: dpal mgrin dang ni dug sel la //
analyzed: dpal mgrin dang ni dug sel la //
translated: (21) śrīkantha, (22) viṣaghna,

original: kri tstsham dka' tshegs sdig pa dang // kun tu gdung ba la sogs la //
analyzed: kri tstsham dka' tshegs sdig pa dang // kun tu gdung ba la sogs la //

original: kru ra drag po rtse med do //
analyzed: kru ra drag po rtse med do //
translated: (27) kṛṣṇa, (28) fierce, (29) tip-less,

original: kroshti / ce sbyang 'o ma dang // rnam par 'joms dang be da'i shing //
analyzed: kroshti / ce sbyang 'o ma dang // rnam par 'joms dang be da'i shing //
translated: (30) kṛṣṇalī, (31) mongoose, (32) milk, (33) Viṣṇu, (34) bīdī tree,

original: kha re bong bu lha seg dang// rnon po'i kha ru so med sbrul //
analyzed: kha re bong bu lha seg dang// rnon po'i kha ru so med sbrul //
translated: (35) khara, (36) donkey, (37) godhika, (38) sharp-toothed, (39) snake,

original: dkar po lhan cig ko la'i 'dab //
analyzed: dkar po lhan cig ko la'i 'dab //
translated: (40) śveta, (41) together, (42) koli leaf,

original: ga ra nad kyi khyad par la //
analyzed: ga ra nad kyi khyad par la //
translated: (43) gara, (44) special disease,

original: ga ram dug dang nye dug byed //
analyzed: ga ram dug dang nye dug byed //
translated: (45) garala, (46) poison, (47) near poison,

original: g'a tram glang po mchog dang lus //
analyzed: g'a tram glang po mchog dang lus //
translated: (48) gātra, (49) elephant, (50) supreme body,

original: byin pa la sogs yan lag dbye //
analyzed: byin pa la sogs yan lag dbye //
translated: (51) divide the limbs such as the hips, etc.,

original: dkar po dang // yungs kar padma can dang mtsho //
analyzed: dkar po dang // yungs kar padma can dang mtsho //
translated: white, mustard seed, lotus, and lake.

original: gha pra nyin mo 'tshe ba la //
analyzed: gha pra nyin mo 'tshe ba la //
translated: [The word] gha is for the day, and for harm.

original: gho ri 'jigs pa mngon par brjod //
analyzed: gho ri 'jigs pa mngon par brjod //
translated: [The word] ghora is for expressing fear.

original: au ma'i ming //
analyzed: au ma'i ming //
translated: [The word] ūmā is a name.

original: gho ra mdud can //
analyzed: gho ra mdud can //
translated: [The word] ghora is for a knot.

original: tsa kra nam //
analyzed: tsa kra nam //
translated: [The word] cakra is for a wheel.

original: dur pa dang ni tshogs pa la //
analyzed: dur pa dang ni tshogs pa la //
translated: [The word] durbha is for a group.

original: @216a * // rtsa kram shing rta'i yan lag dmag / grong gi dra ba chu yi 'khor //🔽ku la dang bya ba sgrub //
analyzed: @216a * // rtsa kram shing rta'i yan lag dmag / grong gi dra ba chu yi 'khor // ku la dang bya ba sgrub //
translated: [The word] rakṣa is for a chariot, an army, a city, a water wheel,

original: snod dang yul 'khor mtshon cha'i dbye //
analyzed: snod dang yul 'khor mtshon cha'i dbye //
translated: [The word] kula is for an action, an implement, a country, a province, a weapon,

analyzed: rtsi tram sna tshogs rmad byung dang // kun nas bris dang thig le mkha' //
translated: [The word] citra is for a variety, a wonder, a drawing, a drop, the sky,

original: rtsi tr'a / rgyu skar thos byed ma //
analyzed: rtsi tr'a / rgyu skar thos byed ma //
translated: [The word] citrā is for an asterism, an ear,

original: lag 'gro dang ni lha mo'i dbye //
analyzed: lag 'gro dang ni lha mo'i dbye //
translated: [The word] citra is for a snake, a goddess,

original: byi ba'i lo ma go tu mab //
analyzed: byi ba'i lo ma go tu mab //
translated: [The word] citra is for a mouse, a leaf, a gotamī,

original: bzang mo dang ni glang mo'o //
analyzed: bzang mo dang ni glang mo'o //
translated: [The word] citrā is for a good woman, a female elephant,

original: rtsi ram wa sta gtsug phud dang // zha nye dang ni ba'i nu ma //
analyzed: rtsi ram wa sta gtsug phud dang // zha nye dang ni ba'i nu ma //
translated: [The word] citra is for a fox, a crest, a lead, a cow, a breast,

original: rtsi ri katstsha ti dang ni //
analyzed: rtsi ri katstsha ti dang ni //
translated: [The word] citrī is for a kachatti,

original: k'a pi ni dang / rtsi kra dang // sgyur ba chu yi lcang ma 'o //
analyzed: k'a pi ni dang / rtsi kra dang // sgyur ba chu yi lcang ma 'o //
translated: [The word] citra is for a kapiñjala, a citraka, a transformation, a water reed,

original: rtsu kra'i / rtsag dang / tsu gri ni //
analyzed: rtsu kra'i / rtsag dang / tsu gri ni //
translated: ṛṣṭa, ṛṣṭa, cuṭa, cuṭa,

original: skyu ru ra yi shing la 'dod //
analyzed: skyu ru ra yi shing la 'dod //
translated: and the tree emblic myrobalan.

original: rtsi tram / zla ba ri'i dbye ba //
analyzed: rtsi tram / zla ba ri'i dbye ba //
translated: citra, caitra, and the division of the moon mountain,

original: shi ba dang ni mchod rten la //
analyzed: shi ba dang ni mchod rten la //
translated: death and stūpa,

original: rtsor chom rkun dung bzang po //🔽rtstsha che gdung sgrib pa la //
analyzed: rtsor chom rkun dung bzang po // rtstsha che gdung sgrib pa la //
translated: ṛṣṭa, ṛṣṭa, thief, and good.🔽ṛkṣa, great, beam, and obscuration,

original: che tr'a sbrang rtsi can dang ni //
analyzed: che tr'a sbrang rtsi can dang ni //
translated: citra, honey,🔽and the rock of the senses,

original: g-yer ma dang ni dbang po'i brag / dz'a ra tshim byed bdag po la //
analyzed: g-yer ma dang ni dbang po'i brag / dz'a ra tshim byed bdag po la //
translated: jāra, satisfier, lord,🔽ṛṣi, certain, and the rock of medicine,

original: rdz'a ri nges dang sman byed brag / dz'i ra zir ral gri dang // t'a ra mtshon dang mgyogs 'gro la //
analyzed: rdz'a ri nges dang sman byed brag / dz'i ra zir ral gri dang // t'a ra mtshon dang mgyogs 'gro la //
translated: jīva, sword, and tāra, weapon and swift one,🔽tintiḍi, chief, conclusion,🔽and the special branch of learning,🔽servant, holding, treatise,

original: tintri gtso po grub mtha' dang // thos pa yal ga'i khyad par dang // bran bza' 'dzin dang bstan bcos dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'gegs pa dang // srad bu ldan dang // rkyad ba mchog / grub pa dang ni sgrub byed thabs //
analyzed: tintri gtso po grub mtha' dang // thos pa yal ga'i khyad par dang // bran bza' 'dzin dang bstan bcos dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'gegs pa dang // srad bu ldan dang // rkyad ba mchog / grub pa dang ni sgrub byed thabs //
translated: cause, and obstruction,🔽having a string,🔽supreme, accomplishment, and means of accomplishment.🔽tantra, knowledge, and quality,

original: tantri rig dang yon tan dang // tshig dang / gu d'u rts'i dang ni //
analyzed: tantri rig dang yon tan dang // tshig dang / gu d'u rts'i dang ni //
translated: and word, and guḍa,🔽and

original: mig dang rab tu rings pa la //🔽ta ti gos sogs sgro ma /
analyzed: mig dang rab tu rings pa la // ta ti gos sogs sgro ma /
translated: [The word] 'ti' is used for eyes and swiftness.🔽'Ti' is used for cloth and so forth, and for a boat.

original: gru sgam // t'a nam zangs dang skya rengs dmar //
analyzed: gru sgam // t'a nam zangs dang skya rengs dmar //
translated: 'Ta' is used for copper and red dawn.

original: t'a ra shin tu mtho dang gzhu //
analyzed: t'a ra shin tu mtho dang gzhu //
translated: 'Ta' is used for very high and for a bow.

original: mu tig la sogs legs dag dang // sgrol dang dag dang grol ba la //
analyzed: mu tig la sogs legs dag dang // sgrol dang dag dang grol ba la //

original: / de nas ni /
